name: Penicillin
description: Common antibiotic that causes allergic reactions in some patients

name: Latex
description: Material used in gloves and some dental equipment

name: Local Anesthetics
description: Numbing medications used during dental procedures

name: Codeine
description: Pain medication that may cause allergic reactions

name: Aspirin
description: Common pain reliever that can trigger allergic responses

name: Ibuprofen
description: Anti-inflammatory medication used for pain relief

name: Sulfa Drugs
description: Antibiotics that can cause severe allergic reactions

name: Amoxicillin
description: Beta-lactam antibiotic commonly used for dental infections

name: Clindamycin
description: Antibiotic used for serious dental infections

name: Metronidazole
description: Antibiotic and antiprotozoal medication used for dental infections

name: Lidocaine
description: Local anesthetic commonly used in dental procedures

name: Nickel
description: Metal used in some orthodontic appliances and dental work

name: Azithromycin
description: Macrolide antibiotic used for dental and oral infections

name: Erythromycin
description: Antibiotic used to treat dental infections

name: Tetracycline
description: Antibiotic that can cause tooth discoloration and allergic reactions

name: Fluoride
description: Used in dental treatments and some patients may have sensitivity

name: Chlorhexidine
description: Antiseptic used in mouthwashes and dental preparations

name: Shellfish
description: May cause cross-reactions with certain dental materials

name: Pollen
description: Seasonal allergen that may increase sensitivity during dental work

name: Cephalexin
description: Cephalosporin antibiotic used for bacterial infections
